name: treatment of residues, MSWI[F]-WWT-SLF, waste emulsion paint, residual material landfill | residues, MSWI[F]-WWT-SLF, waste emulsion paint | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/28173/documentation

The process represents the treatment of controlled landfilling in residual material landfill of a waste (residues) that is exclusively produced in another waste treatment. Residues are a by-product of municipal solid waste incineration (MSWI) of sewage sludge (with 70% water) that in turn is generated during wastewater treatment (WWT) of leachate from the sanitary landfilling (SLF) of  'waste emulsion paint'. Recommended use of this dataset: to be used within the specific chain of treatments for 'waste emulsion paint'. Share of biogenic carbon in the sludge: 0%.

The activity starts with the waste being available at the gate of the treatment facility. Collection and transportation of the waste to the treatment plant is not included.

The activity ends with the waste being treated and waste-specific emissions from the landfill are released to water (short-term emissions to river water and long-term emissions to ground water).
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3822:Treatment and disposal of hazardous waste

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Modelling parameters affecting the treatment technology are specific to this geography and to the technology mix encountered in Switzerland in 2000.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Residual material landfill for polluted, inorganic waste with base seal and leachate collection system (landfill type C). Recultivation after closure.
